import plotly.plotly as py
import plotly.graph_objs as go
import plotly.figure_factory as ff
from plotly.offline import iplot, init_notebook_mode, plot
init_notebook_mode(connected=True)

def muliple_lineplots_plotly(df1):
    data = []
    for col in df1.columns:
        trace = go.Scatter(
            x=[2014,2015,2016,2017],
            y=df1.loc[:,col],
            mode = 'lines+markers',
            name = col,
            line = dict(width=4),
            marker=dict(size=12)
        )
        data.append(trace)


    layout= go.Layout(
        title= 'Top 10 GDP countries',
        hovermode= 'closest',
        autosize=False,
        width=800,
        height=800,
        xaxis= dict(
            title= 'Year',
            ticklen= 5,
            zeroline= False,
            gridwidth= 2,
            tickvals=[2014,2015,2016,2017]
        ),
        yaxis=dict(
            title= 'GDP',
            ticklen= 5,
            gridwidth= 2,
        ),
        showlegend= True
    )

    fig= go.Figure(data=data, layout=layout)
    return plot(fig,filename='myfile.html')


df1 = (gdp
     .drop('country_code',1)
     .query(""" year in [2014,2015,2016,2017] """)
     .set_index('country_name')
     .groupby('year')['value']
     .nlargest(10)
     .unstack()
)

muliple_lineplots_plotly(df1)
alfredsnippet.name: viz top 10 gdp lineplot plotly
